segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on polishing that plate, like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even see the water pouring over the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so oblivious?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting soaked, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, and she’s not paying attention at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool is about to tip, and she’s not even looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless this is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting for a cookie, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, it’s like he’s begging for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just asking for an accident.
segments.speaker: PAR
